Since this post doesn't specify an explicit `image`, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)  # for data prep and visualization
library(lubridate)  # for working with dates
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# read data from csv into tibble named 'sales'
sales <- as_tibble(read.csv('data/AdventureWorks.csv')) |> 
  # reformat date to yyyy-mm-dd and change type to date
  mutate(order_date = mdy(order_date))

glimpse(sales)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Rows: 121,253
Columns: 13
$ sales_order_number    <chr> "SO43659", "SO43659", "SO43659", "SO43659", "SO4…
$ order_date            <date> 2019-07-02, 2019-07-02, 2019-07-02, 2019-07-02,…
$ customer              <chr> "Better Bike Shop", "Better Bike Shop", "Better …
$ reseller_type         <chr> "Value Added Reseller", "Value Added Reseller", …
$ sales_region          <chr> "Southeast", "Southeast", "Southeast", "Southeas…
$ product               <chr> "Mountain-100 Black, 42", "Mountain-100 Black, 4…
$ product_color         <chr> "Black", "Black", "Black", "Silver", "Silver", "…
$ product_model         <chr> "Mountain-100", "Mountain-100", "Mountain-100", …
$ product_category      <chr> "Bikes", "Bikes", "Bikes", "Bikes", "Bikes", "Bi…
$ product_subcategory   <chr> "Mountain Bikes", "Mountain Bikes", "Mountain Bi…
$ product_standard_cost <dbl> 1898.09, 1898.09, 1898.09, 1912.15, 1912.15, 191…
$ order_quantity        <int> 1, 3, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 3, 1, 6, 2, 4, 4, 1, 2, 1, …
$ product_sales_price   <dbl> 2024.99, 2024.99, 2024.99, 2039.99, 2039.99, 203…
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#add sales amount, total cost, and profit columns for each order item
sales <- sales |> 
  mutate(sales_amount = order_quantity * product_sales_price,
         total_cost = order_quantity * product_standard_cost,
         profit = sales_amount - total_cost)

head(sales)
```
